title: Asst. director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a fair and organized process. HR department at GC is organized and does a great job with the whole process, start to finish. I was impressed with the committee that was put together.
Interview Questions: Normal Interview Questions. No surprises

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Met with a supervisor because of networking, and we talked about the needs of the college & how I can contribute to increase engagement for student volunteers. It was a great interview.
Interview Questions: How can you increase the engagement for student volunteers at the college?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty chill, and enjoyable interview. The head of the Learning Center is amazing; the questions are addressed in a way that makes candidates comfortable without being under too much pressure.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past job's experiences

title: Tapride Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Called in for an interview, interviewed, never received a call back. Called them, never received anything back. Total lack of integrity as a hiring manager. I know I didn't get the job but not responding to calls after for a non-competitive position shows a real lack of respect.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone refused to pay?

title: Graduate Research Assistant/Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: There really wasn't an interview process. I practically already have a relationship with a professor to work in a lab. To get into the program, it goes based on a combination of points that you will need to earn. It's best to make sure you get into a lab before entering the program to increase your chances of being accepted.
Interview Questions: Why are qualified for this position?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact was by phone and had a brief conversation if still intrested in the job and if I was confortable with the baseline pay.  I was then told that I would be contacted if my application met the requirements. I was the alled and scheduled for the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your best work enviroment?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and short to the point. Easy and intentional hiring managers. Wanted you to succeed and from the first interview made you feel like you would be valued and heard as an employee.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself bringing as a student employee?

title: University Broadcasting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Come in prepared with documents required. The interview process was simple and easy.  Just let them know your the skills you have to complete the job. Again the process was a simple standard interview.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have for this position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviews for students are great! They are willing to work with your schedule and want you to succeed. You will apply online and then meet in person for the interview.
Interview Questions: A lot about school vs work life

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call and had a phone interview. I was ok. Then I went to an on-site interview. The whole interview was a little bit difficult for me.
Interview Questions: How do you learn a new programming language?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. They need people so you just have to be available. The pay is very low so people come and go from the position. You just have to be nice to get it.
Interview Questions: What are your hours you can work?

title: Career Development Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Macon, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was immediately invited to an on-campus interview where I was given a list of options to present. I had 10 minutes to present on my picked topic. I had a team interview, a campus tour, an interview with my direct supervisor and director, and they served lunch in the conference room.
Interview Questions: About my experience in the role

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview took less than 30 minutes, only had one interview, accepted within 2 weeks of interview. Interview questions were pretty generic. Questions about experience, weaknesses and strengths, etc. Not too bad at all.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with search committee (and chair), then individual interviews with program chair, department chair, dean, and dean of faculty (now provost). Also gave a teaching demonstration, went to lunch with the entire department and then dinner with the search committee.
Interview Questions:
Most alarming questions: You seem really young. Is that going to be a problem? Will you be able to deal with students so close to your age? 

Your accent is really thick. Do you think students will be able to understand you? 

Both questions were asked by a committee member, in front of the chair.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed about a year ago.  Unless their interview process has changed.  The process is way to long for a job that pays less than $35,000 a year. The process took almost four hours.  

During that span, I interviewed with the assistant director of the advisement center, a professor,  a group of three advisor, an entire room of advisors, and the director.  

They all essentially asked the same questions.  I've interviewed for another advisor position and the interview was a little less than an hour.  That is all it takes.

So if Georgia College hasn't changed their way of interviewing, they need to change it ASAP.
Interview Questions: Typical advisor interview questions

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: There were three individuals involved with the interview process, including my senior director of The Give Center and the head office manager. I was presented with various types of questions regarding my position on volunteering, working with others and any oppositions I might have to the work required.
Interview Questions: How would you answer the phone to assist a potential customer/volunteer? Also, what is your biggest pet-peave when you are dealing with employees in customer service

title: University Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview process was a short 30 minute phone conversation.  It felt like it was scripted and didn't actual offer any opportunity to really get to know the applicant or their skills.  There were bullet points on my resume that related directly to this position, but nothing about my related work experience was asked.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?  Really?  This question is never appropriate for a professional position.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview to go through, probably my easiest ever. Essentially was a normal conversation with my potential supervisor, mainly talking about what was necessary for the job. She was mainly vetting me to see if I was personable and friendly. The type of person that would work good with the students that would come into the office. Now this interview may not be indicative of other interviews within the University as this was a student position, but I have had other interviews in the school that have been of a similar format.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in a customer service position before?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to set up an interview. The interview started with two of the current student workers. They asked me simple question about myself. They then directed me to meet with the directors. The directors asked more specific question about my experience and qualifications.
Interview Questions: Are you a leader or a team-player?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. First round of interviews was over the phone with three employees from the same department and lasted about 30 minutes. Very scripted and basic questions. Within about 3 weeks I was called back for an in person interview which took most of the day. About 45 minutes was dedicated to more in depth questions from the same three employees from the phone interview. I had to prepare and present to the employees as if I was already hired and working in the role at a campus fair. Finally, an hour was devoted to a one on one interview with the head of the department. From there it was another 3+ weeks for the job offer.
Interview Questions: Georgia College primarily recruits students from urban areas. What would you do to help recruit more students from rural areas of Georgia and why do you think we're currently not reaching that audience.

title: Social Media Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very conversation like. My interviewer was also my supervisor for the position. He was very laid back and asked me only a few questions. He expressed his need for a social media presence and the nature of the company.
Interview Questions: How would you help GovStrive promote via social media?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Ask basic questions pertaining to the position. Am I tidy? Am I clean? How is my phone etiquette. Everyone I met was friendly and excited to have me on. If you meet their qualifications they hire you on the spot. It sholdnt be too hard to get the position.
Interview Questions: How is your phone etiquette?

title: Student Affairs Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews: phone screen and on-campus.  On campus interview lasted for most of the day and included interviews with search committee, direct supervisor, and upper level administration.  Also included a campus tour and a presentation on a job-related topic.
Interview Questions: Lots of scenario based questions.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview structure and questions. Learn about the department/division that you are applying for, how it supports/provides for the institution, and how you see yourself contributing to it. Furthermore, learn about the institution and makes it unique from the other universities in the system.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Aquatic Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: After filling out an application of interest, management will set up a face to face interview. During this interview there will be at least one of the three facility managers and at least one currently employed Aquatic Supervisor conducting the interview. The questions are fairly basic as we are mainly interested in past experiences, ability to lead, and eagerness to work.
Interview Questions: The questions are not too difficult. The most difficult question may ask you to describe how you handled either an upset patron or an injury.

title: Stockroom Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University (Milledgeville, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I signed up on a list for offered jobs in Herty Hall, Milledgeville, GA
Interview Questions: Do you want to work?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Georgia College & State University in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the masters of biology program and my SAT scores and other science grades led me to be offered a graduate assistant-ship and free tuition. I was hesitant at first because I was actually a non science major in my undergrad and I knew i was going to be taking 6000 level classes and teaching for the very first time. I was reassured that I could handle the work. I did my own personal studying as well as prep work in our shared Graduate assistant office.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can handle teaching your own classes as well as still taking on a full load?
